Package space.sunqian.common.app.di

Interface InjectedApp

All Superinterfaces:
SimpleApp
public interface InjectedApp extends SimpleApp
A dependency injection-based sub-interface of SimpleApp, built via newBuilder(). See DI package documentation for more information.

    • newBuilder

    • shutdown

      void shutdown() throws InjectedResourceDestructionException, InjectedAppException
      Shuts down this app.

      All pre-destroy methods in this app's resources are executed sequentially according to their dependency relationships. If an exception occurs during the execution, an InjectedResourceDestructionException will be thrown and the shutdown process will terminate immediately, and the remaining pre-destroy methods will not be executed. See DI package documentation for more information.

      Once this app is shut down, it becomes invalid and cannot be restarted. However, its sub-apps are not automatically shut down along with it. Sub-apps that depend on resources from this app will generally continue to function normally, as long as those resources haven't been destroyed (by pre-destroy methods) during this shutdown process.

      This method blocks current thread until the shutdown operation is completed.

      Specified by:
      shutdown in interface SimpleApp
      Throws:
      InjectedResourceDestructionException - if any error occurs during resource destruction
      InjectedAppException - if any other error occurs during shutdown operation

    • getResource

      @Nullable default <T> T getResource(@Nonnull @Nonnull Class<T> type)
      Returns a resource instance whose type is assignable to the specified type, or null if no such resource exists.

      This method first attempts to find a resource whose type exactly matches the specified type using Object.equals(Object). If no exact match is found, it will randomly select one resource instance that can be assigned to the specified type from all resources that constitute this app.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the specified type
      Parameters:
      type - the specified type
      Returns:
      a resource instance whose type is assignable to the specified type, or null if no such resource exists

    • getResource

      @Nullable default <T> T getResource(@Nonnull @Nonnull TypeRef<T> type)
      Returns a resource instance whose type is assignable to the specified type, or null if no such resource exists.

      This method first attempts to find a resource whose type exactly matches the specified type using Object.equals(Object). If no exact match is found, it will randomly select one resource instance that can be assigned to the specified type from all resources that constitute this app.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the specified type
      Parameters:
      type - the TypeRef for the specified type
      Returns:
      a resource instance whose type is assignable to the specified type, or null if no such resource exists

    • getResource

      @Nullable @Nullable Object getResource(@Nonnull @Nonnull Type type)
      Returns a resource instance whose type is assignable to the specified type, or null if no such resource exists.

      This method first attempts to find a resource whose type exactly matches the specified type using Object.equals(Object). If no exact match is found, it will randomly select one resource instance that can be assigned to the specified type from all resources that constitute this app.

      Parameters:
      type - the specified type
      Returns:
      a resource instance whose type is assignable to the specified type, or null if no such resource exists
